content:
Posted: August 19, 2016
												First time I saw this, I played the demo of it on the Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II: The Sith Lords Xbox disc.  Original Xbox.  And I was blown away.  Fast forward nine years.  I see it on Steam, and just because I'd been wanting to play it since that day in 2006, I bought it.  I exxpected to find the game having aged like milk.  Was I wrong!  It still looked like that day that I played it on the original Xbox.  And, I tell you what; this game could hold its own against some of today's games.  No problem!  I'll admit, though, it DOES feel a bit odd, now, playing it with a mouse.  This game was a console game, and the aiming felt so good with a right stick.  Even with the Steam Controller and its trackpad, the aiming doesn't feel right, somehow.  But, I digress.  Regardless of the aiming issue, this is still oone of my favorite first person shooters, third only to UT2004, which is second only to DOOM (The original)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2016
												One of the few good things to come out of the Prequel Era.The gameplay revolves around properly managing your squad, and has interesting encounters. The scope is more focused than other, grand and epic Star Wars games, but by the end of the game, you've really connected with your squad. They may all be numbers to the Jedi, but you will remember each character's colour, number, nickname, and preferences.The only unfortunate thing is that the game's premise could have easily made this a 4-player-co-op shooter, but it isn't. The multiplayer is generic and mostly bland, but the single player campaign is definitely worth it. The least enjoyable parts of the game are when you are separated from your squad, working independently. Without the squad management, it becomes a generic shooter set in the Star Wars universe.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 6, 2016
												I remember the first time I put that disk, that artwork of Delta Squad giving me excitement, waiting for this game to finish installing so I could play as a Clone Commando. I was 15, perhaps, maybe 14. Being a Star Wars fan, spending hours playing Knights of the Old Republic, Jedi Outcast and Jedi Academy.Got this on a discount a while ago, wanted to have my old games on Steam. - and still, this feels so damn good.Nostalgia isn't a reason to still hype over this game. Republic Commando did define the First Person Shooter genre, combining a Squad-based Gameplay with a Tactical Shooter. You play your cards right, you don't die. Still, many shooters can't reach this level, they can't make a fast gameplay combined with team management in the middle of the combat. This game gave us a choice to place our commandos in the right places, managing our resources between having more firepower and getting the job done. Not the best variety of weapons, sure; still leading a group of four in various scenarios is enough to get yourself in a challange.If anything, it's worth playing for the story itself. Being a "Deluxe Model" in a Clone Army, leading a squad of Clone Commandos with different characteristics. Listening to them trashing at each other, commenting on kills and reacting to your actions. Well-designed, well-thought.To this day, Republic Commando is still one of the most feature-rich First Person Shooters out there. Still looking good, still has a damn-good story, still enojyable, still challanging. - Do you like First Person Shooters? Then, this is a must have.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 24, 2015
												One of the best Star Wars games I've ever played! Every aspect of this game feels really polished, creative, and researched (well, as much as you can for a sci-fi setting). It all comes together with the gameplay to make a really immersive and surprisingly original (since it's not just re-hashing something straight out of the movies) experience.First of all, the gameplay. After my first session of this game, I actually had a lot of complaints. The enemies feel like bullet sponges - often times taking entire clips just to down one. My squadmates stand out in the open in view of a strong enemy and stupidly march to their deaths without taking cover into consideration. The reticle for the main rifle is really wide and it doesn't feel "precise" like I would imagine a laser weapon would feel. Even when I have an enemy in the crosshairs a lot of shots go wide. However, after my second session these complaints disappeared as I got familiarity with the gameplay. You learn the importance of grenades for taking out the high-health enemies, the importance of ordering your troops around to specific "maneuvers", how to hit targets with all the different weapons, and how it doesn't matter that much if your squad does dumb stuff because you can still win encounters on your own. You start to understand the tactical tradeoffs of the different maneuvers and weapons. So, if you find yourself frustrated or a bit annoyed your first time playing, give it a rest for the day and come back tomorrow.You might notice the squad-based tactics and orders system. If you've played other games like that, you might be dreading having to deal with it, but I think that it's done very well in this game. It's really simple, and they do a great job of helping you keep track of what your squad is doing. There's a lot of subtle ways they achieve this and I won't describe them all. You won't really have to micro manage what everybody is doing using all sorts of different keys - you usually just press F2 so they follow you around, and then point at things in the environment and press "f" to tell a squad mate to perform a specific maneuver. Because it's implemented this way, it's pretty seamless as you switch between shooting and commanding your squad. Even if you go down, your squad can sometimes manage on their own and come revive you.Anyway, it's hard to be frustrated with this game because of the great quick save and quick load system. It's really fast and makes it so you never have to worry about replaying a section over and over. If you do find yourself at a  spot where you keep failing, there's usually a "trick" to the encounter to overcome that spot, accomplished by intelligently using the weapons and maneuvers available to you. It's a nice way to design a game like this - a lot of the encounters are kind of like puzzles, in a way.And all that is just about the gameplay. One of the best things about this game is the detail and the immersion it achieves. I highly recommend going into the sound settings and making sure you max them out if you can, and making sure to play with headphones with the volume high enough. There's all sorts of details in all the little sounds, the writing, the UI elements, the dialogue and one-off things the characters say that manages to not get too repetitive, and lots more that needs to be experienced to be understood.If you like Star Wars games, this is one of the best. Even without that, the game is a fun, squad-based sci-fi shooter. It's actually similar to Halo in a lot of ways, so if you like that game I bet you'd enjoy this.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 30, 2015
												A fantastic game with excellent music and endearing squad humour. In my opinion it has also aged well.You are Delta 38, leader of the 4-man Delta Team who are clone troopers with advanced equipment and medical implants, as well as more personality to help with creative thinking.The gameplay mostly revolves around ordering your squad members into positions, which also tells them what weapons to use. Best of all your squad will actually do what you tell them to, even if it gets them taken out. Makes you wonder how Fallout 4 still can't fix companions standing in doorways!Know that the first area (Geonosis) is the least fun, so stick with it. As you progress the game (slowly) gives you more options, as in there will be more positions than you have squad members, so you will have to make quick decisions while under fire. The pacing gets faster as well, both from more dangerous enemies and more heavy weapons available, but also thanks to good storytelling and use of the loud, epic music this game has.There are good mods to fix common graphical issues/crashes and allow higher resolutions (I played it in 4K).Unfortunately it ends on a cliffhanger as it sets up for a sequel that never came.But yay, Wookie life-debts for everybody!

content:

												Star Wars: Republic CommandoThis is a Star Wars FPS that puts you in control of a squad of elite clones, better known as Delta Squad. Your squad members have different personalities. 												Easily one of the best games I have ever played.When I first played this game I didn't even like Star Wars that much,but this game made me a fan.I get goosebumps only when I hear the game's soundtrack.Gameplay-wise,the game is absolutely beautifully designed.It plays out like a regular shooter game,the guns feel good and you have a decent variety of weapons and enemies.What makes the game stand out,is the tactical element of it.You give orders to your fellow Delta Squad commandos during battle.Knowing where,when and how to control them can make the game easier or harder.Going through the campaign,I never got bored because the game offers enough variety.The storyline is the icing on the cake.It keeps you engaged and makes you love the characters and the universe that they are in.The personalities in the game are fun,interesting and exciting.Even the soundtrack is one of the best in any game that I played.In the end I'd like to express my regrets that we still don't have a sequel for the game...EA please...Sev,hang in there!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 30, 2015
												Star Wars Republic Commando (or as I like to call it also, Band of Clone Bros) is the forgotten and underrated Star Wars video game that everybody that loves the Star Wars franchise should play. The story of the game is based on the 2nd and 3rd movies of the prequel trilogy, where you play as the leader of a Spec Ops squad of 4 Clones of the Galactic Republic who are responsible for performing special missions that occure behind the scenes of the Clone Wars. This is a squad based game, where using your squad team seriously will be your road for victory. The fact that you play as a Clone, fighting along aside with a team of other Clones, breaks the monotony of the usual protagonists of a story of a Star Wars game, which tend to be Jedis, Siths or some random bounty hunter.I agree, like the vast majority of people who played it, that this is a good game - but not a perfect one. It has one problem that I felt frustrated about: while the enemy was agressive against you, your squad team will be very weak and will lack agressivness, unless you babysit them all the time. Sometimes, they will just get close to an enemy and try killing them by melee (it reminds me of the Warscape Engine BS that is now plaguing the Total War series...), instead of trying to get to cover by their own initiative. Another problem  that I have with the game is the lack of variety with the level designs: the game is divided only by 3 chapters, which are limited equally to 3 areas (first you fight in one planet, then inside a ship, and then again in another planet). A little bit of more effort from the producers of this videogame could have created more variety for you to be present in another scenarios/planets of the Clone Wars. But I believe this problem to be minor, when you compare to the much more positive aspects of the game.Still, I cannot recommend you buy it at full price (except if your are a Star Wars nerd :P), since it is an old game and it no longer has an active multiplayermode. Buy it only when it´s in promotion.Like many people claim, this game really needs a sequel - where you play as the same squad team, now part of the forces of the eeeeeeeevil Galactic Empire. It would have been a much better sequel to make instead of the disaster that was Star Wars "BattleFront" EA (THE GAME IS NOT WORTH OF DESERVING OF "BATTELFRONT" ON IT´S TITLE!!!). Unfortunatelly, this game appears to have been forgotten and I don´t think a sequel (or a reboot) will ever be created.7.5 out of 10

content:
Posted: January 24, 2016
												Quite possibly the best Star Wars licenced game out there in my opinion. I have fond memories of playing this when I was 7 or 8 years old back in the day, and the game has not aged AT ALL. Smart squad commands, challenging enemies, a wide and interesting array of weapons and some of the best voicework in a game I have seen. Its not just a great star wars game, but its a great shooter as well. Highly RecommendedPros-Intuitive and innovative squad commands-Interesting weapons, like the Trandoshan projectile weapons and the DC15 system-Great AI, both enemy and teammates-Brutal difficulty even on normal-Wide array of enemy types, and you even get to see characters such as Yoda and General Grevious!Cons-Pretty short, clocked in about 6 hours-Buggy in some sections'-NO SEQUEL

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 7, 2016
												In this game, you are playing as the leader of a special clone commando, you won't see a jedi a single time. Reasoning behind that is to see the military side of the clone wars, not just the "OP Jedi destroys everyone without any losses" one. You have to be tactical, giving commands to your 3 fellow clones, to have all of them survive through the story. The basic idea is fascinating, although I don't believe it to have been done completely right. Whilst you certainly aren't overpowered against the enemy, I don't really see how this game is portraying the bad side of war, as clones are still beeing shown as the good ones, while their enemies are the bad guys, and you won't ever build up any feelings for any of the characters out there.However, the gameplay feels solid, and the tactical part of the game was enjoyable as well.The graphics are OK to play now-a-days, while some textures, like the ones of your three clone companions, have very high resolutions, other parts, for example the skyboxes, often highly lack in quality.If it is on sale for less than 5€ /5$, I would recommend you buying it specially as a Star Wars fan.2005 this would've probably easily gotten 9/10 points, 2016 I would rather give it a solid 7/10.

content:
Posted: January 9, 2016
												If any game in the Star Wars universe needs a sequel it is this game. As short and repetive as this game can get Republic Commando at least gave you exactly what you expected without any fluff or bullcrap. The game isn't perfect but it was the best at what it needed to do at the time. I dont care who or what i have to do in this world to get another of this game, but the idea of a strategic team of clones running around behind the scenes of war and doing things that you havent heard of for good reason is a brilliant way to add to the Star Wars universe without ever having to break Cannon or mold to the story. They can be anywhere doing anything and the story will always make sense as long as they dont fight or kill important characters to the rest of the universe. I love it.

content:
Posted: July 26, 2013
												Star Wars Republic Commando, Knights of the Old Republic, and Battlefront 1 are considered the Holy Trinity of Star Wars games.  You can put Rogue Squadron in there as well, but these three are always the ones everyone always talks about.  Republic Commando is an FPS set during the period of the Clone Wars where you command an elite clone unit called Delta Squad.  As you travel throughout the galaxy and undergo missions you will be faced with very difficult challenges, very immersive gameplay, and a cast of characters you will never forget.  This is a no-♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t game.  It's hard, it's fun, and it leaves you begging for more.  I remember this game came out during the time of Halo 1 and after playing both I thought Republic Commando just kicked way much more♥♥♥♥♥  This is a game you must play if you're a Star Wars fan or an FPS fan.  You will be hooked right as soon as you give your squad that first "BREACH THAT DOOR" command.I'm giving this game a strong 9.5/10.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 24, 2015
												One of the best Star Wars games I've ever played! Every aspect of this game feels really polished, creative, and researched (well, as much as you can for a sci-fi setting). It all comes together with the gameplay to make a really immersive and surprisingly original (since it's not just re-hashing something straight out of the movies) experience.First of all, the gameplay. After my first session of this game, I actually had a lot of complaints. The enemies feel like bullet sponges - often times taking entire clips just to down one. My squadmates stand out in the open in view of a strong enemy and stupidly march to their deaths without taking cover into consideration. The reticle for the main rifle is really wide and it doesn't feel "precise" like I would imagine a laser weapon would feel. Even when I have an enemy in the crosshairs a lot of shots go wide. However, after my second session these complaints disappeared as I got familiarity with the gameplay. You learn the importance of grenades for taking out the high-health enemies, the importance of ordering your troops around to specific "maneuvers", how to hit targets with all the different weapons, and how it doesn't matter that much if your squad does dumb stuff because you can still win encounters on your own. You start to understand the tactical tradeoffs of the different maneuvers and weapons. So, if you find yourself frustrated or a bit annoyed your first time playing, give it a rest for the day and come back tomorrow.You might notice the squad-based tactics and orders system. If you've played other games like that, you might be dreading having to deal with it, but I think that it's done very well in this game. It's really simple, and they do a great job of helping you keep track of what your squad is doing. There's a lot of subtle ways they achieve this and I won't describe them all. You won't really have to micro manage what everybody is doing using all sorts of different keys - you usually just press F2 so they follow you around, and then point at things in the environment and press "f" to tell a squad mate to perform a specific maneuver. Because it's implemented this way, it's pretty seamless as you switch between shooting and commanding your squad. Even if you go down, your squad can sometimes manage on their own and come revive you.Anyway, it's hard to be frustrated with this game because of the great quick save and quick load system. It's really fast and makes it so you never have to worry about replaying a section over and over. If you do find yourself at a  spot where you keep failing, there's usually a "trick" to the encounter to overcome that spot, accomplished by intelligently using the weapons and maneuvers available to you. It's a nice way to design a game like this - a lot of the encounters are kind of like puzzles, in a way.And all that is just about the gameplay. One of the best things about this game is the detail and the immersion it achieves. I highly recommend going into the sound settings and making sure you max them out if you can, and making sure to play with headphones with the volume high enough. There's all sorts of details in all the little sounds, the writing, the UI elements, the dialogue and one-off things the characters say that manages to not get too repetitive, and lots more that needs to be experienced to be understood.If you like Star Wars games, this is one of the best. Even without that, the game is a fun, squad-based sci-fi shooter. It's actually similar to Halo in a lot of ways, so if you like that game I bet you'd enjoy this.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 16, 2016
												Ah, I love this game. I remember playing it when it was on the X-box, and was is great to play it again.It's a squad based action shooter, with rather intelligent AI companions (Although they can't use any weapons other than the main gun unless in special cover). You play through the game taking place during the Clone wars as a elite squad sent on special missions, and in my opinion it really nails that atmosphere of taking on the impossible odds, as your sent against increasingly difficult hoards of enemies. Keep it mind, it isn't an RPG, there are no real choices or decisions to be made, and there is no multiplayer scene, giving it unfortunately very little replayability other than for enjoyment. It is a fun game however, and offers some of what I feel is the best squad gameplay and teamwork mechanics even compared to newer games today. Worth picking up if you just want to shoot some baddies and lead a commando team.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 7, 2013
												Star Wars Republic Commando takes place during the Clone Wars and the game follows the story of Delta Squad, an elite unit of Clone Troopers tasked with special operations. You're the squad's leader, Delta 38. You have the ability to command your troops, whether it be to breach doors or take  up a sniping position. The game will take you to the following locations: Geonosis, an Acclamator-class assault ship, and Kashyyyk. Command your troops through each campaign to set charges, computer slice doors, set up sniping positions, and many more to effciently complete your mission. Multiplayer for this game is no longer provided.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2013
												If you're a fan of FPS's and Star Wars, this is the game for you. It's great fun bossing around your fellow troopers, having a complicated battle strategy and it really makes you feel like you're operating your own team of commandos. However, it can get very boring at times, probably because I don't like single-player FPSs. After hours and hours of plowing down B1s with your assault and wasting several clips of sniper ammo on the B2s, it does lose its entertainment value and just becomes another FPS. However, it can still be fun if you play it correctly.

Command your troops through each campaign to set charges, computer slice doors, set up sniping positions, and many more to effciently complete your mission. Multiplayer for this game is no longer provided.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 24, 2015
												So I first played this game way back on the original XBOX like some odd 8/9 years ago. I was (math is hard) 9 or 10 then, and I thought the game was cool, but it wasn't ground breaking or life fulfilling. So I played it, beat it, and really didn't think about it too much.Time passed and now I'm 18. I saw this was on sale and I said to myself, "Hey, I totally remember this game from way back when! I've got some spare pre-Christmas dough, so lets give it a go!" Best 3 bucks I've spent in a while.  PRO   Obviously, amazing price tag. 3 bucks is basically less than a half hour's work at minimum wage.  Solid core gameplay mechanics. The A.I. is reaaaaly good for this time of development, and squad commands and actions are smooth and natural.  Atmospheric environments. Cliche, I know, but this game hits it home on the atmosphere. As a commando, you really get a Halo ODST feel to your character (really bada** but not Master Chief-invincible) (BTW I'm not comparing ODST to this game bc I know a lot of people feel strongly about the game but w/e ok back to main points). For example, on a specific mission you go onto a derelict, abandoned Republic destroyer to investigate why it went missing. As you enter the ship, you get overwhelmed with just how big the ship is. Your squad splits up to cover as much ground as possible, so you go alone into your section of the ship. It's got a nice Death Troopers feel to it (GREAT BOOK BTW).  AMAZING CHARACTERIZATION. So this one is really important to me. I feel like lately I have played waaaaayyy too many games that just throw in characters somewhat relevant to the storyline without actually giving half a crap about establishing who they are, where they come from and how they act. Sev, Fixer, and Scorch (your squadmates) all come from the same clone production facility and program, but they have DISTINCTLY different and memorable personalities. Sev is your deep voiced, hunt-loving, bada** sniper. Fixer is your narcissistic and protocol following technician. Scorch is your curious, optomistic, reckless explosive specialist. Seriously good work put in here. Oh yeah and they don't just tell you who they are at the beginning of the game and then treat them as generic clone troopers the rest. Their character traits and facets stick with you throughout. Streamlined HUD and squad commands. They put in basic controls for your squad (Attack formation, defensive formation, defend area, regroup) that just about anyone with a cheese brain can conquer. They also designated certain cover positions to be used for lobbing grenades, sniping, or AT weaponry, which is a nice touch and a boon to locking down an area. Also, your hud is like actually looking through a trooper's helmet. So that's +1 for atmosphere again.Diverse yet comprehensive inventory. Your sniper rifle, rocket launcher, and machine gun are all variants of your blaster rifle; it creates a professional feel about your loadout. You also have your handy-dandy blaster pistol, which is a good backup. Lastly, you're kitted with 3 different grenades (Thermal detonator, flashbang, and anti-mech EMPs. You can also pick up alien grenades too.). Added on to your traditional inventory, you can pick up elite weapons from dead enemies if they drop them. The hardest enemies to kill drop the best weapons to use. Dope.There's more I could touch on, but those are the basics. Cons would be a slight lack of content and game-time, lack of multiplayer/other gamemode, and sometimes buggy AI but I'm forgiving on that. All in all a great game. I can appreciate the theatrics and core mechanics of the game now more than I could back then, and by heavens I hope that someone someday comes out with a worthwhile sequel to this. If you're a fan of Star Wars, I would ABSOLUTELY reccomend this. The storyline covers some aspects the movies don't, and the ending is very satisfying to the total storyline of SW. If you're not a huge fan, I still reccomend. This game can be really difficult at times, but it's still a worthwhile FP shooter that should be tried out. If you absolutlely hate it, it's still only just 3 bucks (at least right now). 9.5/10 ayy lmao

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 6, 2016
												I remember when this game first came out and my dad purchased it on the original xbox. back then, I thought the game looked cool just because it was starwars. well fastfoward roughly 11 years into the future and during that timeframe, I had sadly forgotten about this gem. You see my console was a sony playstation 2 and this game was an xbox excusive when it came to home consoles. Well I caught a steam sale for the starwars collection and decided to purchase it because it had both 2 kotor games and battlefront 2. One day when I was scrolling through my library to find something to play, my mouse had landed on republic commando... The moment that main menu music started playing was like a flash of nostalgia. The memories of the cool starwars game were back but this time I was the one experiencing it firsthand.Few things about the game.The ai is fantastic, from having them man turrets to heal eachother and yourself (you'll need it) I found the ai to be some of the best i have ever experienced.Although this game is over a decade old, I still think it has some pretty fantastic graphics that definitly aged well (specially with settings maxed)The soundtrack is just amazing... that purfect pix of classic starwars tracks with remixes and new tracks made specifically for the game. no moment was ever a dull one.The difficulty is indeed harder then most other shooters (specially starwars ones). Dont go into this with a battlefront mindset at all or you will have a hard time.personally, I would drop current steam price on this game BUT if you find it on a sale, you owe it to yourself to add it to your library if you like starwars or good fps games.

It's great fun bossing around your fellow troopers, having a complicated battle strategy and it really makes you feel like you're operating your own team of commandos. However, it can get very boring at times, probably because I don't like single-player FPSs. After hours and hours of plowing down B1s with your assault and wasting several clips of sniper ammo on the B2s, it does lose its entertainment value and just becomes another FPS. However, it can still be fun if you play it correctly.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 1, 2014
												This game feels like it should have been made in the 90s, when memorable characters and good stories came to games without question.It's an FPS where you lead a squad of clone soldiers - all who manage to have a distinct and enjoyable personality - as you tear around behind the curtains of the Star Wars universe.  You won't jumping from any rooftops in flashy lightsaber fights, but your crack team of mighty mortals finds their own way to be awesome.Squad controls are simple, too.  It reminds me of a more involved Mass Effect.  You can give general orders like fall back or take cover, but all throughout the level are little hot spots that a squade mate (or yourself) can take advantage of.  Lot of enemies in a room?  Get someone on the turret.  Just make sure you cover him on the way over there so he doesn't get shot (or you do it, and have your guys cover you).It's a surprisingly great game with a fun concept, delightful characters, and solid mechanics.  It's aged, but not so much that it's not worth $20.

												This is truly an amazing game. Take a step into the life of a clone commando, where you are responsible for the lives of your squad mates. This is one of the greatest Star Wars games of all time! Immerse yourself into the awe inspiring Star Wars World to command a clone squad, as their leader you must be responsible for their strategic actions and welfare. With the use of in-game techniques based on real Special Ops techniques, set up your squad in the best way possible to take down the CIS! In this expansion of the Star Wars universe, wield new, unique weaponry designed to fit the aliens that conceived them! This game is one of my all-time top favorites and I rate it at 10 out of 10! I have never come across such a distinctive game as this, both in story and gameplay! I recommend this to anyone who enjoys strategic gameplay, first person shooters, Star Wars, or well written story lines! "Enemy eliminated, proceeding to next sector!"

content:
Posted: March 28, 2015
												I wish there was a star rating for steam, because while Republic Commando is a good game, it has a lot of problems. Its singleplayer campaign is just too short, bordering the length of the original portal, and the finish is anticlimactic. You just start to connect with your AI squadmates when the campagin ends, and its kind of frustrating that they couldn't have added on another mission or two. On the positive side its a fun game with a lot of strategy and a decent enough plot, but I'd wait until it goes on sale before buying it. I also really enjoyed the mechanics for working with your AI squad mates, and I wish more FPSes did AI interaction as well as this title. All in all a good game, but with dated graphics and thats just too short.

content:
Posted: February 8, 2015
												10 years ago, when this game originally was released, I got this game but the thing is... I never finished it. Why I don't know, can't really remember. Because of that, I was really happy to see "Republic Commando" as part of the 'Star Wars Humble Bundle' - I could finish what I started so long ago.Was it worth it? Both yes and no - mostly yes. The game is very simple in comparison of what we've got today, but it's still Star Wars and it has got some fun action throughout the game. It's a tactical first person shooter where the player is the commando of the Delta Squad and you have the ability to give the other three soldiers commands - "Attack that enemy", "Snipe from that position" and similar things.As I stated before, it got some good shooting but was pretty linear and monotone - the environments are pretty same-looking and the enemies are pretty much the same ones everywhere. I know, there's not much variety in the Star Wars movies either, but still... they could be somewhat creative.If you get a chance of getting this on the cheap, I'd say "go for it"! Also, if you're a big Star Wars fan... go for it!

												If you love Star Wars, and you love a First Person Shooters, with an Awesome Storyline then this game is for you.I fell in love with this game when it was released back in 2005, and still 10 years later I still jump on and play some Republic Commando. This game is still an awesome game, and I Highly recommend it. Its  a squad based FPS,but what I love is that each of your squad mates has there own personallity and great Dialogue. Set in the Clone wars, you are taking up the role of a Clone Commando, its a different look at the Star wars Universe, through the eyes of a soldier, instead of a Jedi, which is what makes this game interesting This game never gets old, and is, in my opinion one of the best Star wars games out there, along with the Star Wars Battlefront II.There is however no more Multiplayer which is a bit of a shame, but still this game is worth buying for just the singleplayer alone, although the storyline isnt long, it still got that great Star wars feel to it, and you will be begging for more. There are an array of weapons, which is what you should expect from an FPS, weapons range from ones that the Commandos use, and then there are ones you can pick up from different cultures, from all you enemies.So even though this game is 10 years old if you are still considering buying it don't think twice, you wont regret it.10/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 12, 2015
												One of my favorite Star Wars games and favorite First Person Shooters in general, an excellent example of what the universe of the prequel trilogy can be when placed in the right hands.  The campaign mission doesn't exactly tell a compelling story (its 3 narrative arcs broken into smaller missions) and the gameplay can be repetitive, but the whole experience is solid thanks to the squad based combat.  It really feels like you have control over your squad, each combat situation ends up feeling like a puzzle you need to carefully strategize with team placement to solve.  I've beaten this 3 times since the original came out on the Xbox and I will probably play through again at some point, highly recommended, even if it isn't perfect.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												Released in March 22, 2005 this first person Star Wars game is probably the best thing about the prequel films. In this game you are 1 of many clones being trained to be Commando's of the Republic on Kamino. Basically the Republic Commandos are the Navy Seals of the Star wars universe. The game takes place during Episode 2: The Clone Wars and is supposed to bridge the gap between Ep2 and Ep3. I always found this game awesome because of the perspective. What I mean by that is that most star wars games always focus on the Jedi or you are this master sith lord or something that gives you an advantage over the others. While in this game it gives you a soldiers perspective of the Clone Wars, which was greatly overlooked during the films. You play as the leader of Delta Squad; a 4 man expertly trained group each with special abilities and skill sets. Sev is the Sniper, Fixer is the hacker, Scorch is the demolitions expert and you... well you are simply the Boss. Although the game emphasizes that each has special ability sets, anyone of your group can do the task you tell them todo. The game is one of the first games that I know of that puts you in control of AI. For example if you see a vantage point you can call out one of the commandos to snipe over there, or if you notice one member is low on health you may send them off to heal. This mechanic brings a variety of ways to play the game but also makes you actually feel like the leader of this squad. Each of the characters in my opinion each have their own personality that doesnt make them dull or boring and makes you want to care for them. The game starts you off on an assassination mission on Geonosis but then leads to other planets like Kashyyyk and broken down space carriers. I personally loved the campaign because you are only a soldier so alot of the time you are just as curious of the mission as they are. The game has great combat with a variety of weapons and a fair difficulty level that you can change at any time. The grittiness that this game brings to the star wars universe is awesome and is defiantly  a must play for any Star Wars fan that can find a original Xbox copy or buys it for $10 off Steam.OVERALL:This game is a great first person shooter that takes place in the star wars universe and should be played by anyone who enjoys that. Also the game has team deathmatch multiplayer so if you are into that sort of thing you should play now before the servers shut down!9/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 26, 2015
												TLDR: I love this game above all others, and when you're done with it several times, I'm confident you will too.Again, not really good at writing reviews. I will however state that I absolutely love this game.Don't let the few hours clocked on Steam fool you. I only bought it on Steam because it's more convenient than using 2 very worn CDs.I've played the campaign at least a dozen times over the years. Sadly, the campaign is short, but in no way does the campaign length negatively impact the absolute quality of this game.Best squad-shooter I've ever played. Excellent voice acting. Squadmate lines are witty and charming, and the squad is extremely affable. There is no way you will not like all of them, though it is very likely that you'll have a favourite. Mine is Scorch :)And you will experience true loneliness when you and your squad split up on several occasions to achieve independent objectives.Again, I love this game above all others and I would recommend this game to anyone, anyday and everyday, Star Wars fan or otherwise.If you value exellent gameplay, simple yet elegant squad mechanics, amazing voice acting, witty one-liners, affable teammates, dark and immersive atmosphere, brilliant music and everything else that makes an excellent game excellent, you would be severely amiss to let this game go unplayed. And when you're done with it, play it again. And again.One play through hardly does the game justice as it impossible to get take notice of all the gems it offers with just one play through.Infinity/10."Clone Advisor: Delta Squad, clear that promenade!Scorch: Promenade, sir?Fixer: Shut it, Six-Two."

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 10, 2016
												Star Wars Republic Commando is a First Person Shooter with a tactical twist, to control your squad! Not only does it deliver a solid and outstanding narrative, but it also proves that you can get a connection with characters through numbers. No pre-rendered cutscences needed!Shooting: The game can be tough, it really can. It is in no means easy and the guns have the right amount of star-wars and unique twist. There isn't the biggest array of weapons, and i often found myself sticking with the default commando weapon(s). Oddly enough, these space weapons also have a tiny bit of a recoil. No idea how that works, i just know that i enjoy shooting them.Controlling your squad: It's smooth, yes, but sometimes it doesn't really work because of the odd AI, your squadmates aren't always intelligent and they're often very slow. Luckily, it can be very useful to know where to put them, and once you've put them there, they'll stay there.(Unless you go down and they have to save you.). Overall, it needs a bit more depth, but it works a lot better than most games these days.Your squad: Delta are absolutely the coolest looking clone-commandos in the galaxy! They are familiar with each other and have some rather cool and talketive interactions. People like 07(Sev) is the badass sniper who's not very talketive with a gruff voice and well, a few twists. I don't remember the other characters that much, but that's because i haven't played the game in a while. The AI however isn't that well-developed and often clunky.Conclusion: Despite the lack of multiplayer (RIP gamespy), the weird AI and the short length of singleplayer. I encourage anyone to drop those 10 Euro's on this game. Because it really is worth it. Not only will you remember the game as something that ABSOLUTELY needs a sequel, but also one that needs to be more noticed. In short: The game is great. Seriously, if you haven't bought this game yet, i encourage you to buy it.

content:
Posted: May 9, 2016
												This my friends ... This is a game. *note* I have played this game no doubt 500hrs off steam.  There's so much action, drama, and story. Let's see what we got! Gameplay - This game runs extremely well, given that I kept my old pc machine with windows xp lol. The gun fights are super fun and the melee isn't hard at all. Moving around is easy, and i've had no issues with it, hasn't crashed at all.Graphics - Back in the day ( dang i'm getting old ) this was amazing to gaming standards. The realistic blood and gore, bodies jiggled around if you shot them, etc. To todays standards it's not graphically " amazing " but it looks a lot better than some games that came out 5yrs after it. Other - The story is pretty interesting. You're a squad of elite commando's trained and bred to be a one man army. You have Scorch (Delta 62) The classic goof off and jokster that loves blowing stuff up. He's made me chuckle more than once and keeps the squad in good spirits. Fixer (Delta 40) is the brains of the team, he can hack anything and is a loyal soldier that follows orders perfectly, and does everything by the book. Sev (Delta 07) well ... Sev is Sev. Tick him off and he will kill you. Seriously, he will. He's the hot headed one that's just misunderstood, and will do anything for his brothers. He's a weapons expert and loves to kill anything that stands in the squads way. The squad AI is just perfect. I look at other stupid AI's in games, and think to myself, " Why can't all AI be as good as my squad?! " They follow your orders perfectly, warn you of enemies, and if you die they will fight tooth and nail to revive you. You really bond with your family. Yes, family. These are your brothers, and you feel close to them ... This story will make you laugh, grit your teeth, and cry. I wholly recommend this game. They just don't make 'em like this anymore ... EA is making Star Wars Imperial Commando 2 - DON'T screw it up EA. Or i'll have your heads on a plate. 10/10 easily.

content:
Posted: December 31, 2015
												As far as I've been able to play it, brilliant game!This game seems to be a lot better than I would've ever expected. It's great for Star Wars fans especially those whom love the Clone Wars. It's extremely fun to actually be commanding a squad rather than being the "newest recruit" in the squad. You're all brought up the same way and you all became part of a team together which really puts the equality between your team. The great thing about this is rather than viewing them by their rank, despite that they're all pretty much the same in this game anyway, you can view them by what they're specialized in.Another great thing about this game is that your character can actually talk! YES! You read this correctly! Unlike almost EVERY other FPS, your character can talk! And he talks as much as the rest of the squad which can lead to some really interesting conversations between the squad.However, as with every other game, there are some flaws. This game can be INCREDIBLY difficult which really puts people like me off of playing it. Because who wants to play the same mission 100 times just to move to the next, even harder, section of the mission. If you're someone who hates having to search up walkthroughs, good luck trying to complete this without going to YouTube. Another flaw that links in with this, normally games use hints for you to find out how to get around a certain enemy in this game. As much as I've focused on the surroundings, enemies AND dialogue, I haven't noticed any hints since Geonosis.To sum up, for someone who hates a lot of FPS games I really enjoy this and I will continue to play it... When I can be bothered to look up the walkthrough for the mission on the Acclamator-class Assualt ship.I rate this game:7/10

content:
Posted: December 30, 2015
												If you like first person shooters and Star Wars, then you will enjoy this game. Simple but intuitive squad commands add depth to the FPS gameplay. The campaign mode doesn't take very long to finish, but it's fun and the commandos are well done characters. Each of them has personality and adds to the squad in a meaningful way. The game does have a multiplayer aspect, but I don't know much about it because I've never played it. Some technical notes; this game runs well on medium to high settings with integrated graphics. I'm running it on an Acer Aspire XC- 603G (a cheap Walmart PC given to me by a family member) and haven't had any issues on medium settings. I played this on the original Xbox back in 2006 and it's a better experience even on a low-end PC. 10/10 did purchase again.

content:
Posted: January 3, 2011
												There is one outstanding game mechanic in SWRC, and that is that you can never really die. When you "die" you are really just incapacitated. And when you do, you have the ability to force the AI to come heal you or to make them follow current orders (btw, the menu looks awesome here).Republic Commando has another amazing game mechanic, and that is to be an utterly INANE, EXTREMELY GENERIC FIRST PERSON SHOOTER. There is absolutely nothing else in this game that makes RC stand out against other games. It's like the developers just gave up after making it Rainbow Six or any Tom Clancy game.That's not to say it's a terrible game...well..actually, come to think of it, it is pretty bad. The levels can be rather confusing and full of tedious objectives and enemies (many of which [I'm looking at you Super Battle Droid] have obscene amounts of health and take forever to die).See rest of review here: http://gamespotting.net/gameblog/review-star-wars-republic-commando/

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 7, 2015
												I bought this game on release and for years since I've always wanted to go back and play it again, but I could never remember why until I bought it again. Despite having to jump through numerous hoops in order to get it optimised for a modern operating system, Republic Commando is a surprisingly wonderful game given that it is, in many ways, a rather standard corridor shooter.Whilst genre-wise it may play as a rather standard FPS shooter, the writing of the characters and the missions gives a much greater depth to the world than it otherwise ought to have. You play the commander of a crack team of Republic commandos, and your teammates all have distinct and consistent personalities, and are autonomous enough to make them seem genuinely intelligent. Yes, you will be giving orders for the most part - and their AI is programmed well enough so as to feel like they're an extension of yourself, as they should - but you won't need to tell them to heal themselves, or attack the bad guys if a threat looms, and should you be overcome and you need help, they will be promptly at your side healing you at the risk of their own lives. And this all helps to develop a genuine bond with your fellow squadmates, particularly as the game is much easier when you have their help, further emphasising the importance of your cumulative strength as a team. On top of this, the missions, whilst comprising of many parts, manage to consistently escalate the stakes until by the end of the mission you feel a genuine and frantic rush of adrenaline as you plunge headlong into the final stages of each operation. And it's the little things that make a difference - for example, whereas most games would have an alert announcement indicating that your vessel will self-destruct, in this case they're serious. And it's these little things that actually make you emote as a player, which is what any experience should do, whether it's a book or a movie or a video game.  And thus, Republic Commando manages to rise above it's state and hold up quite well as a challenging and compelling experience. I'd recommend it to Star Wars fans primarily, although I think it has a wider appeal because of the quality of the writing.

												Star Wars Republic Commando is a really fun game. It provides an awesome experience in the Star Wars universe. It is also hard as nails. I definitely reccomend it, and if you get stuck, you can press the '@' key which opens the console, and type in 'TheMatulaakLives' (This puts you in god mode.) My one wish would be that it was possible to play the campaign co-op.But yeah, it's great.

content:
Posted: May 11, 2014
												"Scavenger Drones" (roughly translated to "holy ♥♥♥♥ing♥♥♥♥♥♥why do I keep dying") are hostile, and deadly, enemies encountered. They are about the size of a toaster, and hover 3 meters above the ground using AntGrav Hover™ technology. Upon seeing a Republic Commando, they will fire a constant beam at them. This beam has a 100% chance of hitting the commando, sometimes even if they are behind a wall. Once this beam is fired, the Commando has approximately 1.3 seconds to destroy the drone, or they will be killed. This is no easy task however, as the drones are small, fly incredibly fast, and have a 75% chance to dodge bullets. Also, they like to hunt in numbers, usually seeing about 3 or 4 of them in a pack. Why the man who designed these drones meant to siphon resources out of disabled ships thought it would be a good idea to make them kill people, I have no idea.

												This is one of the best FPS games i have ever played, and dont let the pictures fool you, the game has been updated but the store page has not. if this isnt the best FPS game ive ever played, then it is definetly the best single player fps game i have ever played; amazing story, amazing gameplay, and missions that are difficult enough that you dont beat it the first time for every single one. the only downside to this game is that like most other star wars games, the multiplayer was removed, and because of that i give it an 8/10. also, i took a look at all of the negative reviews, and all of them are either a) negative because the game crashes if you change the resolution; this was fixed in a recent update. b) negative because of other gameplay and lighting issues; these have either been fixed or the person just didn't have a good enough computer. c) because the mouse sensetivity on the startup screen is insanley high. this one i actually agree with, but its really not a good reason to give the game a bad review.

content:
Posted: December 3, 2013
												Republic Commando is a tactical first person shooter where you are the leader of a small squad called Delta Squad. The gameplay is much like any other shooter however instead of run and gun the player must order their squadmates to perform different functions such as slice a terminal, set a bomb and get behind cover and use various weapons including sniper, anti-armor and grenade. They will also target one enemy, form up on the player, go to a certain location or search and destroy. On top of that the player has a special weapon called the DC-17 which was interchangeable from assault rifle to sniper rifle to anti-armor launcher. The Player also had a full HUD that made it feel like the player was really in a clone trooper helmet.  One of the other cooler features is instead of dying you just go down and you can either call a squadmate over to revive you, maintain their orders and kill everything before getting you or just reload a save.  A lot of these features worked perfectly it isn’t like whoever could develop the sequel couldn’t just use all these features all over again. It begs the question where is the sequel if the gameplay mechanics are already there and ready to be used again. 	You are Delta RC-1138 or “Boss,” the leader of Delta squad who has in it RC-1262, “Scorch,” the comedic relief /explosives expert, RC-1140, “Fixer,” the by the book soldier that specializes in slicing and RC-1207, “Sev,” the hunter/sniper. You start out in your birthing tube on Kamino and it shows your training as you age. Eventually your squad meets up for the invasion of Geonosis during the beginning of the clone wars. There Delta Squad is tasked to infiltrate and assassinate Sun Fac, a Geonosian leader. Along with that they have several other objectives that they accomplish including destroying an underground droid factory and retrieving launch codes from a Trade Federation core ship. 	One year after the invasion of Geonosis Delta Squad is set to investigate their original ship the Prosecutor to find out why it has not responded in several weeks. During this they find out the Trandoshan Slaves and Mercenaries have taken over the ship with the help of the Separatists in order to capture and bring the ship back to a Separatist base. Delta Squad ends up destroying all of the Trandoshans and defends the ship from a Trade Federation Battleship that attacks shortly after. 	The final mission involves Delta Squad being the advance recon team on Kashyyyk and to help the Wookiees to fight back the Trandoshan Slavers and Separatists that have control of the planet. They end up rescuing General Tarfful and run into General Grievous themselves but only end up fighting those IG-100 Magna Guards that carry the Electrostaff. Eventually Delta Squad makes it to where the Separatist Battleship has linked itself the giant citadel tree and they destroy it. They end the game on a cliffhanger as Sev had been captured and the invasion of Kashyyyk by the main republic force had begun which once again begs the question, why not continue the story and have a sequel. 	Now the graphics aren’t anything to write home about but they are fairly impressive for when this game was made, 2005, but what really makes this game look impressive is the HUD for the clone troopers and the art assets they created for the game. Lucasarts did not separate themselves from canon too much in that the story of Delta Squad lines up perfectly with that of the actual Star Wars universe and Extended Universe. 	Republic Commando is actually the first Star Wars game that featured licensed music that included the song “Clones” by the band Ash which sounds awesome. On top of that they included all of the heavy battle music from John Williams you may have heard from any of the other Star Wars movies. The voice acting is also superb as for most of the clone troopers and Delta 38 was voiced by the original actor for Jango Fett, Temuera Morrison which I thought was a nice touch.  	Overall this game is actually one of my favorite Star Wars games of all time and is an absolute classic in terms of story and gameplay. With the disbandment of Lucasarts, in order to make a sequel some developer is going to have to get rights to both the Star Wars IP and the Republic Commando IP which could make it quite pricey. •	Story  - 4 out of 5•	Gameplay – 4 out of 5•	Graphics – 4 out of 5•	Sound  - 5 out of 5•	Fun – 5 out of 5Pros: -	Fun gameplay/squad commanding-	Great music and voice acting-	Star Wars UniverseCons:-	Can get annoyingly difficult with the lack of ammo at times-	Repetitive enemies I’m giving a Total score of 90%

content:
Posted: December 22, 2015
												GLANCE RECOMMENDATION: 83% YES / 17% NOGOODGreat clone wars commando troops and squadAll 3 squad mates have their own flavor, but aren't exclusive to their speciality (e.g. the demolitions guy isn't the only guy that can undergo demolitions tasks, but he's just faster at them I think)Guns are fun, with your main gun having 3 variations (rapid fire, sniper, anti armor) with a fifth slot for alien guns and a surprisingly superb melee attacklots of chances to use squad tactics and assess sitations to make better calls. you can direct which cover to use and enemies to focus on.squad functions feel fun to use (ordering squad mates around and changing tactics)NEUTRALGraphics are fine. Kind of plain and you fight the same enemies for large chunks of time, but they make good use of it.BADStory is fine overall and closes out at a steady pace, but ends abruptly at a point you feel like more came after.SUMMARYOverall they really nailed the tight squad combat and made the combat fun. I'd be very interested to see this get another entry.

content:
Posted: February 4
												-Reposting since 32 fanboys can't understand that MISSING SOFTWARE is an issue with a game and SHOULD BE TOLD TO THOSE THAT HAVEN'T BOUGHT THE GAME YET. Fun Fact: "Yes" that makes the review helpful, even if its not an issue for your preferences. It might be for people that are not you. That is a major reason to have reviews and read them. NOT THE ORIGINAL CONTROLLER COMPATIBLE!?! /RAGE QUIT. Understand, I Love This Game, it is a great game but they sell a crippled version of it. This was originally an (Microsoft) Xbox game and to not have an obvious (Microsoft) controller option is stupid. Yes; Xpadder.com provides a "work around" (you just have to build the button layout profile yourself)... But not everybody wants to buy a copy of the Xpadder program, or one like it. If these control setings are not an issue for you, do buy this FPS. (Fun Fact: Linking a patch to play a great game is helpful. You might even find someone that needs it one day.)Lore/TLDR = I bought this game on Xbox when it came out. It's 'like' the first Halo only you get great AI teammates and the gore is /shiver the first few times blood splatters your face. I loved it. I've even read all 5 of the Republic (and Imperial) Commando books by Karen Traviss. So this game was one of my first purchases (main reason I bought the complete Star Wars pack) and I was going to play this with a huge nostalgic grin. But my Xbox one controller is not an option, only mouse and keyboard. I had to calm down just to find a work around via google. Took about 15 mins to instal and learn how to use the Xpadder program. It works very well for a button jury-rig. I'll even be enjoying GW2 with it. Conclusion = For a gamer like me controls are everything; this controller issue only effects users like me and this obvious lazy move by the development team is the worst thing I can say about the game. (Or might just be more of Microsoft's quiet war against Steam. Illuminati confirmed.) Which means this is still one of my favorite games, but I'm going to leave this as a negative review as a warning to others that this is NOT THE ORIGINAL plug and play control settings.

Posted: May 14, 2015
												Listen to the others- This is a great game. I am about to finish the game right now even though it only says I have a few hours. (I had no wifi at one point so I played offline.) At school when I mentioned 'Star Wars' some of my friends questioned  me except one, (the one who showed me this game) and I explained that this isn't a six year old Jedi v. Darth Vader game. It has a very unique, fun play style. You play as a Commando of 'Delta Squad' with a funny, helpful team. I breezed through it because I'm not new to conserving ammo and first-person shooters. (It's helpful to use the pistol a lot.) Though, at some parts, especially when locking up the Republic ship, it was hard. But I'll have to give this game five stars because of the great gameplay and amount of fun put into a game that reminds me of my childhood.

If you like tactical shooters, this is also a game for you. Just freakin' buy it.

content:
Posted: May 8, 2015
												It's bloody, gritty and rather tricky. A Star Wars game for a more mature demographic with likable characters with, albeit cliched, personalities. You got your rough and tumble borderline serial killer 07 - SevYou got the fun and dumb but highly trained demolitionist 62 - ScorchYou got the bottom feeding, intellegent and downright square 40 - FixerThen there's you, the quick thinking leader of Delta Squad - 38 - BossThey may have differing personalities and prefernces but at the end of the day each sqaud member is very copy and paste in terms of usefulness and each one gets the job regardless of what they prefer to do which is good, why leave a Commando half cooked?The gameplay aspect was astounding. The Ai are intellegent (bar some hiccups) and follow orders very well. You say 'Search and Destory' they'll take point and peek around corners before engaging the enemy.Say 'Group Up' and, well, they come to you like a Jack Russel that heard a bag open.Give the order to 'Secure Location' and they actually dig in, taking cover behind objects and not leaving that spot unless you put them on a position but even if one goes the other two stay and keep digging in, its great if you need to heal at a bacta station under heaby fire.Lastly there's the 'Move On' command which ends whatever action the commando's are doing and will either fall back to a secured location if a marker was placed or come back to you.In battle you HAVE to be the leader. These guys wont do more than cover and shoot unless you point them towards a turret, sniper location or explosive ordinance spot. There's nothing finer than having all three squad mates on useful points as you go against a small army of droids. There are also non-combat meneuvers like Slicing a terminal, setting a detonator charge or Breaching and Clearing a room. Your surroundings are as much of a weapon as anything though, one part I liked was when I had my squad distract a heavily armoured spider droid while I snuck around the back, sliced a terminal and dropped a crate on its head.Droids also have this annoying habit of being extremely hard to kill. Maybe the battle droids are easy but Super Battle Droids, Destroyer Droids and Spider Droids are tough and require you to focus the entire squads fire on one at a time. There are other enemy types but I wont spoil it.All in all this is a fun game but with a sadly abrupt ending. It almost felt like they ran out of funding halfway through and ended it at the worst moment possible. I literally felt like someone came into my bedroom and pulled the blug on my PC, that was how abrupt the ending blackout was.All in all you can get some 15-16 hours out of it which isn't too bad. It's a good game with solid FPS mechanics and some great voice acting where it counts and despite its abruptness the ending was fairly good and will leave you wanting more.9/10 solid gameplay with very very few glitches but with an abrupt ending

content:
Posted: November 9, 2011
												I loved and hated this game. It felt long because the gameplay felt repetitive and long after awhile. The gameplay is pretty much run and gun. The squad is frustrating at times because they aren't too smart and will stand there at times while people are shooting at them. The graphics are kind of old school. The game is good for Star Wars diehards but for the average FPS gamer its something that gets long to play as the game progresses. I felt myself wanting the game to end really early in the game because of how repetitive it got. The great thing about this game was the soundtrack, it was very well done. The online portion of the game is small but still active. The online portion is the thing to play if you want a fun experience with it. The story of the game was confusing and left you wondering. The really annoying thing about this game was the ammo and guns, if felt like you ran out of ammo too fast. Get it if you love Star Wars, but not if your looking for a good story and gameplay.

												There is alot of things this game does right and alot of things this game does wrong. And your squad mates were majorly interchangable, they can all do the same tasks and don't have near enough dialogue to make you really feel differently or tell any real difference between them personality wise, but to be fair they are clones. the AI was was average,  most of the enemies just stood still and occasionally changed attacks that they used but ther were some mobile enemies that did chase and follow you, only to get knifed in the face. overall it's a good game, but i suggest playing it in segments/parts, dont play the whole thing at once or your gunna get real burnt out.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 8, 2015
												It's bloody, gritty and rather tricky. A Star Wars game for a more mature demographic with likable characters with, albeit cliched, personalities. You got your rough and tumble borderline serial killer 07 - SevYou got the fun and dumb but highly trained demolitionist 62 - ScorchYou got the bottom feeding, intellegent and downright square 40 - FixerThen there's you, the quick thinking leader of Delta Squad - 38 - BossThey may have differing personalities and prefernces but at the end of the day each sqaud member is very copy and paste in terms of usefulness and each one gets the job regardless of what they prefer to do which is good, why leave a Commando half cooked?The gameplay aspect was astounding. The Ai are intellegent (bar some hiccups) and follow orders very well. You say 'Search and Destory' they'll take point and peek around corners before engaging the enemy.Say 'Group Up' and, well, they come to you like a Jack Russel that heard a bag open.Give the order to 'Secure Location' and they actually dig in, taking cover behind objects and not leaving that spot unless you put them on a position but even if one goes the other two stay and keep digging in, its great if you need to heal at a bacta station under heaby fire.Lastly there's the 'Move On' command which ends whatever action the commando's are doing and will either fall back to a secured location if a marker was placed or come back to you.In battle you HAVE to be the leader. These guys wont do more than cover and shoot unless you point them towards a turret, sniper location or explosive ordinance spot. There's nothing finer than having all three squad mates on useful points as you go against a small army of droids. There are also non-combat meneuvers like Slicing a terminal, setting a detonator charge or Breaching and Clearing a room. Your surroundings are as much of a weapon as anything though, one part I liked was when I had my squad distract a heavily armoured spider droid while I snuck around the back, sliced a terminal and dropped a crate on its head.Droids also have this annoying habit of being extremely hard to kill. Maybe the battle droids are easy but Super Battle Droids, Destroyer Droids and Spider Droids are tough and require you to focus the entire squads fire on one at a time. There are other enemy types but I wont spoil it.All in all this is a fun game but with a sadly abrupt ending. It almost felt like they ran out of funding halfway through and ended it at the worst moment possible. I literally felt like someone came into my bedroom and pulled the blug on my PC, that was how abrupt the ending blackout was.All in all you can get some 15-16 hours out of it which isn't too bad. It's a good game with solid FPS mechanics and some great voice acting where it counts and despite its abruptness the ending was fairly good and will leave you wanting more.9/10 solid gameplay with very very few glitches but with an abrupt ending

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 14, 2015
												Listen to the others- This is a great game. I am about to finish the game right now even though it only says I have a few hours. (I had no wifi at one point so I played offline.) At school when I mentioned 'Star Wars' some of my friends questioned  me except one, (the one who showed me this game) and I explained that this isn't a six year old Jedi v. Darth Vader game. It has a very unique, fun play style. You play as a Commando of 'Delta Squad' with a funny, helpful team. I breezed through it because I'm not new to conserving ammo and first-person shooters. (It's helpful to use the pistol a lot.) Though, at some parts, especially when locking up the Republic ship, it was hard. But I'll have to give this game five stars because of the great gameplay and amount of fun put into a game that reminds me of my childhood.

content:
Posted: July 8, 2014
												This game is amazing. I've been playing it ever since it came out on the Original Xbox, and I maybe have 1000+ hours into it. My childhood summers were defined by this game. And not because it's a great tactical shooter, that has an amazing soldier atmosphere and command system, but because it's fun. The story is full of humor, darkness, and original Star Wars themes. The multiplayer is solid, with no problems I can think of. I remember shooting my neighbour off the multiplayer maps and absolutely breaking the game :) If you like Star Wars, or the Clones of Star Wars, this is an amazing game for you. If you like tactical shooters, this is also a game for you. Just freakin' buy it.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 28, 2015
												Ah yes this game. A gritty Star Wars FPS playing the role of a Republic Commando taking control of a small squad to complete various tasks in the name of the Republic. This game was quite the blast to play.First off the combat is fun and engaging with various weapons and a few unique ones too. You also have a squad to command and you can order them to various tasks such as arming explosives, taking sniping positions and so forth. The music holy hell isn't it beautiful? Especially at the title screen. One of my favourite parts about this game is the amount of detail put into this. You can see your helmet on the wholeway through and when enemy blood splatters on it, it gets wiped away. There are some other cool little things I won't spoil. Not to mention the game looks good in general.I've played both the PC and Xbox version and I would recommend the PC version. It has better controls overall but the Xbox version is an impressive feat in itself. This was one of the last Star Wars games in the Golden Age of Star Wars games before there was silence but things are looking a little bright now. This game gets an 8/10.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 11, 2015
												This game is up there with Metroid Prime and Unreal as being one of my favorite FPSes ever, plus one of my favorite Star Wars games. I just wish it was longer.Unlike most FPSes I've played, where the combat's attempt at a frantic pace just makes it an annoying mess of white noise, Republic Commando's squad-based gameplay forces you constantly calculate battlefield tactics as opposed to just trying not to get shot.The game's biggest weakness comes in a few brief segments where you're forced into a tactical situation by yourself, where one stray bullet can drop you; or when you're given a time limit, which in one case resulted in me finishing a level with literally a second or two left on the clock. The intensity of the firefights makes completing your objectives in time an incredible strain.Besides that, the game is only three missions: Geonosis, a deralict Republic battlecruiser, and Kashyyyk. Thankfully, each of these missions will last you a good three hours a piece, so I wasn't left feeling like I'd played an unfinished game. I was, however, left wanting a lot more. In particular, the notion of this game's encounters playing out organically, with nonlinear level design (and a lot more levels), sounds like the workings of one of the greatest FPSes ever.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 13, 2015
												I have played 2 hours and 30 minutes of this game so far, and I AM LOVING IT. The game has you play as a Clone Commando, designated "Delta 38". Your squad (Also named "Delta") are also highly trained clone commandos. The graphics aren't terrible (in fact, I kinda like them) despite the fact that this game is pretty old. It took me a while to get used to the controls, as mouse 3 is Aim, not right click (which is grenade).  Gameplay is VERY solid, and FUN. Its starts out easy, but quickly gets DIFFICULT, even on the normal mode.  And in the beginning, when you dont know how to counter the enemies, it can take anywhere from 30 seconds to 2 minutes to destroy new enemies, such as Super Battle Droids. But that is quickly remedied when you have the tools and experience.  The AI is actually REALLY good, as in, unlike games like Call of Duty, the friendly AI can actually shoot and kill things. This is really helful, especially when there is many or tough enemies. Also, since we're on friendly AI characters, I LOVE THEM. All your fellow Commandos, despite being clones, are very human so far. They have different personalities, and in the short time I knew them, I started caring about my "brothers".  Although there are some Friendly Fire incidents (both me and my squad's fault) I felt like this made them even more "human" (probably due to the ammount of friendly fire that happens in other games like Arma or Insurgency). You can also give your team orders, which I find to be promptly followed and well executed, which has been a huge assist. So in conclusion, I will list what Ive found;-Solid shooter gameplay-Nice, easy, and fun squad based mechanics-Many different enemies in the campaign-Human like characters (For me anyway)-ACTUALLY HELPFUL TEAM AI (very important)-Very Very Fun.-graphics are still alright (depending on your tolerance to old graphics)The few bad things I have found are:-Enemies sometimes bug and dont move or shoot-Allies sometimes get stuck on a position, making them take a while to execute the order.-old graphics

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 1, 2014
												It`s a good and fun game, but it`s not a complex tactical shooter in the Star Wars universe I was hoping for. The gameplay is painfully linear and there`s very little tactial depth to it. You can`t give commands to individual soldiers, sniping positions are fixed and cannot be assigned by the player, and door breaching has no additional options (like throwing in grenades or something). Rainbow six - Vegas has actually more depth and tactics than this and that`s saying something :( The levels in this game are very restrictive (You follow a hallway with some rooms). Another giant weakness is setting the game within the prequel trilogy, so you`ll be killing a lot of droids in stead of strom troopers/rebels. The main protagonist uses a Codename outbreak style multi purpose rifle which can be adapted to many different weapon types, which is kind of a letdown. The guns in this game seem to be a little underpowered not doing as much damage as You would like them to do. Iwas generally dissatisfied with this title but for a sci-fi action fan, who likes tactical elements and doesn`t hate the SW prequels- it might be good shooter.

content:
Posted: September 5, 2015
												Pros:-The voice acting is good-The music is great-The story's decent-The game's challenging-Enemies are varied-The tactical portion of the gameplay is well executed, for the most part-The DC-17m(default primary weapon) is badassNitpicks:-Using bumpmapping on high will most likely cause issues(can be fixed with a mod, but installing it will render you unable to play online with anyone who doesn't have the mod)-No widescreen support(can be fixed)-Some enemies are really cheap -The graphics show their ageCons:-The DC-17m feels weak, in its base form-Multiplayer's an afterthought-The sights on the DC-17m are hard to use-The crosshair makes hipfiring awkward-The friendly AI isn't too great, and tends to fail against higher-tier enemiesThis game is pretty much Star Wars and Rainbow Six: Vegas crammed into one game.  It's fun, albeit annoying, sometimes.  The game doesn't look like much, by today's standards, but it's good for its time.  If you're a Star Wars fan, or are into shooters, I think you should check this out.

content:
Posted: December 25, 2016
												Ce jeu a été une excellente surprise. - Les graphismes ne font pas trop vieux (l'univers visuel de Star Wars aide)- On gère une escoudade et ça c'est génial. On peut enfin donner des ordres à ses coéquipiers! C'est ce qui me manquait à Space Marines! Choisir le couvert (sniper, démolition, grenade), qui va poser la charge explosive, pirater le terminal. Tenir la position, avancer de façon agressive, rester en formation, prendre une tourelle etc.! Il faut gérer son personnage et les trois autres, et ça donne une dimension géniale au jeu! - L'histoire est courte mais très sympa. On voit comment la République ne repose pas QUE sur les jedis. Et la fin... manly tears, bro.A acheter. Je regrette de ne pas y avoir joué avant les votes Steam pour le jeu devant avoir une suite.

content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
												Star Wars: Republic Commando is perhaps the greatest singleplayer FPS ever. Despite looking a bit aged, it runs well and is still as fun as ever. You play as Delta-38 (Boss), as the leader of Delta Squad, consisting of your explosives specialist and joker Delta-62 (Scorch), your levelheaded computer specialist Delta-40 (Fixer) and resident sniper/psychopath Delta-07 (Sev). You travel between three levels: the desert planet Geonosis, the start of the Clone Wars, the RAS Prosecutor, a derelict Republic Assault Ship (Ex Machina y u do dis to me) and Kashyyyk, home of the Wookies.The game is particularly notable for its advanced squad AI, which hasn't really been matched since. Your squadmates are easily capable of holding their own for a while, but the perfect balance is struck between the need for player input and AI competence. You also have the ability to command your troops to perform actions such as snipe enemies, hack terminals and man turrets.In conclusion, Republic Commando is a must-buy for any Star Wars or FPS fan.10/10 would use AT-TE again.

content:
Posted: April 12, 2015
												One of the best Star Wars game around, you play a squad leader of a special clone trooper - Delta squad in a linear FPS while able to give command to your squad and even can determine the pace of the battles, this game got a great storyline ,enjoyable Squad banter, excellent music, also, although the characters are clones – each of them has unique personality and you can actually get attach to them  (eat your heart call of duty devs – this game manage to do everything you couldn't do right in your games)This game ends on a cliffhanger - too bad the sequel to this game was canceled  :(

content:
Posted: September 26, 2014
												really decent game. countless hourrs from my youth were spent playing it on disk when it first came out, way way way too many hours.in modern context the game holds its own, though its graphics have aged (gracefully and tastefully though might i add) and its Ai is not as polished as something from 2010 upwards your squad is always reliable and the hostiles always competent.that said, there are so many bullett sponges in the game it makes me mad, if there was a way to tweak the damage output for both hostiles and friendles (character included)  to far reater heaights then this game could rival many a modern shooter, and if story and atmosphere is taken into account it could probabley beat it too.

Posted: January 9, 2015
												I remember playing this, splitscreen. On my original xbox. The feels.... I beat it when I was a kid, and saw it on sale and bought it... This is... ONE OF THE BEST star wars games you will ever play. The graphics are wearing off, but the gameplay is still top notch. Better then COD, Or really any other high franchise shooters. This is, and will be one of my top ten game of all time. Its amazing, and even if its not on sale, i reccomend getting it. This will re-create/make your childhood. No need for a high end PC either. Get this.Now

												An amazing FPS that will immerse you in the eyes of a Delta Squad Republic Commando. This game was released in 2005 and still holds up today. If you are a fan of sci-fi and or the Star Wars universe you will love this game. My only complaint is the abrubt ending but that takes nothing away from the experience.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2013
												This is an FPS Star Wars game that puts you in the role of a clone commando soldier. It has a bit of a darker, more realistic tone but still keeps very faithful to the Star Wars licence. In this game teamwork is key and you develope a bond with your brothers/squadmates over time. It has just the right amount of challenge and you can even play co-op with your friends! This is an amazingly designed game that I can recommend to any Star Wars fan.
